title: How to Wash and Blow Dry Locs

steps.title: Rinse your hair under water for at least five minutes with warm water.
steps.content: Rinse your hair under water for at least five minutes with warm water. Long rinses ensure that locs are completely penetrated to allow a full cleansing. Warm water opens the hair cuticle to allow shampoo to penetrate deeply.

steps.title: Apply shampoo directly to scalp and locs.
steps.content: Apply shampoo directly to scalp and locs. Squeeze shampoo into locs a few times to clean inside the loc as well. Avoid shampooing more than a few times because it can lead to over dryness. [1] X Expert Source NoÃ«l Reid-Killings Celebrity Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 25 November 2020.

steps.title: Rinse for at least 5 minutes with warm water.
steps.content: Rinse for at least 5 minutes with warm water. Product build-up can occur if shampoo and other products are not completely removed from locs.

steps.title: Apply oils of your choice.
steps.content: Apply oils of your choice. Use 100% all natural oils that are not cold pressed.

steps.title: Put hair in a plastic shower cap and wait to rinse for at least 30 minutes.
steps.content: Put hair in a plastic shower cap and wait to rinse for at least 30 minutes.

steps.title: Rinse with cold water.
steps.content: Rinse with cold water. Cold water closes the hair cuticle to retain moisture.

steps.title: Dab dry locs with a cotton t-shirt.
steps.content: Dab dry locs with a cotton t-shirt. Towels lead to lint build up in locs.

steps.title: Attach the diffuser attachment to blow dryer.
steps.content: Attach the diffuser attachment to blow dryer.

steps.title: Apply heat protectant to hair avoid heat damage.
steps.content: Apply heat protectant to hair avoid heat damage.

steps.title: Blow dry locs around head until dry.
steps.content: Blow dry locs around head until dry.

steps.title: Apply oils to replenish moisture in locs.
steps.content: Apply oils to replenish moisture in locs.
